thread.title: Convenient Cell-Phone-Carrying Accessory Invented by InventHelp Client (WGH-4487)
thread.title_full: Convenient Cell-Phone-Carrying Accessory Invented by InventHelp Client (WGH-4487) - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: Convenient Cell-Phone-Carrying Accessory Invented by InventHelp Client (WGH-4487)
text:
InventHelp is attempting to submit this idea, the PHONE PACK, to appropriate companies for their potential feedback.
PITTSBURGH, PA (PRWEB) October 11, 2015
While hunting, an inventor from Homer City, Pa., found himself constantly checking texts from hunting buddies and family. Becoming annoyed at having to constantly remove and replace his phone from his pocket, he was inspired to design a better and more convenient way to carry a smartphone while engaged in physical activities. The next day, he went home, designed, and then built the patent-pending PHONE PACK prototype.
The PHONE PACK is a harness and phone-holding pouch that allows smartphone users to conveniently and securely carry their smartphones while engaging in their favorite activities while on the job site. It secures a user's smartphone in a convenient location, allowing the user to protect, secure and easily access the phone during daily and specialized activities. This device is ergonomic and perfect for the active leisure user or the busy, on-the-go professional.
The original design was submitted to the Pittsburgh office of InventHelp. It is currently available for licensing or sale to manufacturers or marketers. For more information, write Dept. 14-WGH-4487, InventHelp, 217 Ninth Street, Pittsburgh, PA 15222, or call (412) 288-1300 ext. 1368. Learn more about InventHelp's Invention Submission Services at http://www.InventHelp.com - https://www.youtube.com/user/inventhelp
